fields.description:
Custom actions are very useful to integrate external command line tools, like git-tfs, into SourceTree.

I would like to create a custom action for every command I need to use, but I can't because some actions need arguments that aren't provided by SourceTree or arguments that should be provided by the user, such as the Work Item number to be associated with the TFS check-in.

git-gui's (the default GUI for Git) custom action feature has an option to show a dialog with a text box and puts the user input into an $ARGS variable.

I've tried to start a PowerShell script from a custom action with no success (there seems to be some problem with quotes and paths containing spaces). The script would show a dialog with a text box and then call the actual command.

I think none of these solutions are ideal. Creating scripts for every command that need extra arguments is cumbersome. Showing a single input box and putting the value into a single variable makes the user deal with the command line options, which is exactly what I'm trying to avoid.

I wish I could specify the number of non-trivial arguments needed and a message to prompt the user for each argument. Variables could be named $1, ... , $N (the name doesn't matter).
fields.summary: Extra arguments dialog for custom actions

fields.description: In the diff pane if line number is greater than 99 (3 or more digits) then the numbers shown are cut off so for example
fields.summary: When diffing changes line numbers are cut off

fields.description:
I had been (happily) using SourceTree v1.5.2 for some time without issues. Yesterday I received an upgrade notice pop-up in the software and upgraded to v1.6.3. I immediately began having application crashes within seconds of opening SourceTree. When I start SourceTree, I see the UI for a few seconds and then it crashes. This happens continuously.

To resolve this, I uninstalled SourceTree (v1.6.3) and reinstalled the older v1.5.2 version. Now it too crashes constantly - within 30 seconds of opening the application. I have rebooted which did not help. I have tried closing all my open git repos, it still crashes. No other changes were made to my computer in the past 24 hours except for installing SourceTree v1.6.3.

Is there any error logging, any debug option/etc I can enable to try to resolve this issue? As of right now, SourceTree is completely unusable for me.
fields.summary: SourceTree Crash Loop since upgrading to v1.6.3

fields.description:
By default, the option "Use the staging area" is not selected in SourceTree 1.6.3 but staging area is still being used.

Enabling the option "Use the staging area" and click OK does not save the setting too.

It is not possible to disable staging area anymore
fields.summary: "Use the staging area" option is not working

fields.description: Hello. I downloaded the latest version of SourceTree for Windows. The staging area is present, but when going into Options->Git, the checkbox for "Use the staging area" is already unchecked. Checking it does nothing (it reverts to unchecked after going back into Options) and doing so does not change the presence of the staging area. It is stuck on. I do not want to use the staging area. In previous versions of SourceTree it works as expected. I am using 1.2.1 on another Windows computer.
fields.summary: On 1.6.3 for Windows, the "Use the staging area" checkbox is stuck "off" but the staging area is permanently on

fields.description:
Currently, SourceTree update automatically if there is a new version

However, if the new version does not suit the user requirement, it is impossible to downgrade it because SourceTree will auto update it later
fields.summary: Option to disable auto SourceTree update

fields.description:
In version 1.6.x, selecting the checkbox for unstaged files will auto stage the file and the screen will reload.

This make it harder to stage a few files at the bottom of the list because the screen/list will auto reload due to staging files
fields.summary: Selecting the checkbox for unstaged files should not auto stage the files

fields.description:
When I select a file in either the staged or unstaged file areas a diff shows up in the right-most difference pane. The UI keeps refreshing and clearing the diff pane. If I select a new file, I can see the diff for that file for a few seconds before it refreshes and clears.

SourceTree is unusable -- I can't review or select changes for commit at all.
fields.summary: Diff view constantly refreshes

fields.description: I edited the commit messages of my last two commits via the interactive rebase, before SourceTree crashed unexpectedly. I will attach the log.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed after editing messages in interactive rebase

fields.description: When I close Feature, Hotfix or Release (Git Flow) I uncheck "Delete branch" checkbox and check "Push changes to remote" one. But SourceTree deletes remote branch anyway. The local branch stays in place.
fields.summary: Delete branch when I uncheck "Delete branch" and check "Push changes to remote" in Git Flow options

fields.description:
Sometimes it's impossible to drag a file to stage it (in file status view). Usually what happens instead is that all the items above gets selected (see attachment). Deselecting the file and trying again does not work. Using the checkbox to stage works fine however.

This never happened in 1.6.1.
fields.summary: Dragging to stage a file sometimes stops working

fields.description: Error "index.lock exists" occurred while trying to stage files and couldn't close the progress window with "Close" button. Had to close a program.
fields.summary: Can't do nothing if error on Stage occurs

fields.description:
I am using the Log/History tab as my main area. When committing, it used to remain the active tab, but for 1.6 I am returned to "File status", which is annoying. I thing the tab that was selected should remain selected.

BTW, great work with SourceTree!
fields.summary: UI change: After commit, "File status" tab is always shown

fields.description:
I think the new cleaner UI has now some problems:
File status panel 
1) information "nothing to commit", why? Better approach is to se blank staged files box a and blank unstaged file box.
2) Commit message - this is wrong. This is really big step backwards to Sourcetree usability. In previous version was commit more clear. I was able to see everything I want to commit at one place. Now I can see only changes is selected files. (It also automatically selects files which are not staged to commit - it is confusing)
3) Drag and Drop works only on icon, not on whole items (between staged an unstaged areas).
fields.summary: Problems of new user interface

fields.description: Snapshot included
fields.summary: When sorting by file status, files with same status are not alphatically ordered

fields.description:
As of version 1.6, the way to stage files in SourceTree has changed. Now, every time we select the checkbox next to an item, it is automatically staged. 

Personally, I think the former approach was superior. 

For instance, if we want to stage multiple files, in the previous version, I could simply select all the files, and then press the "stage selected" arrow. Now, I think we can achieve doing a multiple select, then right-click and press "Add" action. However, this is more confusing.

The other approach to do that would be to review each unstaged file, one by one, and then stage explicitly as we go. Before 1.6, I would just enable the checkbox for each file I want to stage, and sometime later press "stage selected". Now, every time I do that, it stages automatically, refreshes the window and if I have a big list of items, even the scroll position changes...
fields.summary: Staging of multiple files in Sourcetree 1.6

fields.description: Add option to assign the editor which will be used for "Open Current/Selected Version" options
fields.summary: Editor for Open Current/Selected Version

fields.description: Remove Tools > Options > Git > Use the staging area because it's doesn't work and a switching of using the staging area was moved Log/History view options
fields.summary: Staging area option

fields.description: I was deleting some local branches to clean up and after one of them SourceTree crashed.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes after deleting local branch

fields.description:
After upgrading to 1.6.3, I can't commit any files - it just shows "Nothing to commit". Although in commits list I see "Uncommitted changes", but it's empty if I try to see what's uncommitted. Exactly the same with 1.6.2

Had to downgrade to 1.5.2 to be able to commit and do my job as I used to. After downgrading I can see the changes and I'm able o commit these files.
fields.summary: After update to 1.6, can't use SourceTree

fields.description:
The User Interface in v1.6.1.0 is significantly slower on Windows.  Fade in menus are clunky, the file status diffs sometimes do not show up, clicking the option box for staging/unstaging files is extremely laggy.

System info: 

* Windows 7 ultimate
* i7, 2.70 GHz
* 64-bit
* 8 GB of RAM, using 6.76 GB
fields.summary: V1.6.1.0 UI is significantly slower than the previous release

fields.description:
When a dialog box pops up in the application, it's customary to allow the ESC key to dismiss the dialog.  This action cancels if that option is available or simply OK's the dialog if that is the only choice.   

How to get this to happen:
* make local changes in a repo
* in Stash, click Pull to update from origin
* A dialog box titled "Pulling" appears with the text:

{quote}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false fetch origin

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false pull origin feature/xxx
fatal: Couldn't find remote ref feature/xxx

Unexpected end of command stream

Completed with errors, see above.
{quote}

ESC or tabbing to the close button and hitting the space bar should dismiss it.
fields.summary: Dialog boxes do not close with ESC key or have button focus

fields.description:
Giving the ability to open a Markup (.md) file in SourceTree through an overlay popup preview similar to how JIRA & Confluence render selected image attachments would be hugely beneficial for the end-user who may be disconnected from Internet access & wishes to easily view their README.md file for example offline.

Future interactions could even include a WYSIWYG type editor introduced into the diff area of SourceTree.

A great example of this is http://github-markup.dfilimonov.com/

Moreover,
By having such a feature supported, Atlassian / SourceTree would have one up on the Git GUI competition (y)
fields.summary: Render / Preview Markup (.md) files

fields.description:
a) I've moved some files in my folder
b) The deletion/creation of those files was displayed in the lower window (unstaged files)
c) I was clicking the checkboxes to stage the file moves when an unclosable dialog with an error got displayed

The button "fermer" (close) was not working, I had to kill SourceTree and restart it.
fields.summary: Uncloseable dialog after staging file with an error

fields.description:
As reported as a comment to http://blog.sourcetreeapp.com/2014/08/19/sourcetree-for-windows-1-6-now-available/, source tree auto-add to index (AKA puts in staging) any file that is found to be unstaged.

This includes:
- per-merge files (.orig)
- backup files (Emacs's *~)

and the worst one:

- conflicts not ye resolved... that are quickly automatically flagged as resolved, clobbering the source-code with merge markers (<<<, >>>, ===, HEAD... etc) without a chance to fix/merge them

Whether SourceTree is running in the front or iconified does not change the behaviour.

I consider this as being a blocking defect, as it completely defeats the fundamental quality of Git: merge tracking.
fields.summary: SourceTree 1.6.x auto-add any file to the Git index

fields.description:
One of the strong points of SourceTree is that the UI shows different areas for "Unstaged Files" and "Staged Files".

I think you could improve the interface by adding another "frame" to manage the commits sent on PRs. 

Please check the mock-up image that I have added to this issue, it should explain more than words.

With this possible new "frame", it would be really simple to revert, edit, add commits.
fields.summary: new UI to manage commits in current PR

fields.description:
The time source tree takes to process simple commands like commit, staging and other takes too much time. I am using more and more the cmd to do any operations to save time.

If the time it takes to process commands does not improve, I am thinking of dropping sourceTree in favor of a liter UI to support git.

I am logging this in hope that it improves instead of simply moving on.
fields.summary: Operations in SourceTree are take too much time...

fields.description:
If a change is made to a file that is currently selected in SourceTree, the entire diff view is cleared when the screen is updated.  In order to see the diff you must modify the current selection (add or remove a selected file) for the diff to reappear.

In previous versions of SourceTree, the diff view was updated to account for the recent change.
fields.summary: Changes made to currently selected file clear diff view

fields.description: Error when dragging and dropping files from unstage to stage. It works ramdomly
fields.summary: Error when dragging and dropping files from unstage to stage

fields.description:
After updating SourceTree to version 1.6 (or 1.6.1, 1.6.2, 1.6.3) I am unable to discard hunk / selected lines for Mercurial repo. I can only discard a whole file.
There are no buttons for that.
fields.summary: Unable to discard hunk/selected lines - Mercurial

fields.description:
(actually using 1.6.3, but Jira doesn't know that version yet).

I have two branches.
My current branch deleted a bunch of files.
A remote branch (origin/develop) altered files after the branch point.

Merge in branch origin/develop.
There correctly are a number of files in the list of conflicts.

I select all files and select the "Resolve Conflict->resolve using mine" option from the context menu.

I get "Could not update one or more files, please check that no other application is locking your files."

I expected that sourcetree marked the files deleted and resolved.
fields.summary: Merge conflict resolve doesn't work when I deleted files.

fields.description:
Steps:

1. Go to commit screen
2. Add one or all unstaged files
3. Click the tab key

I expect: next tab stop will be the commit message textbox (this is what I almost always want to do after adding a staged file)

What currently happens: next tab stop is actually the next open repo tab, completely removing me from the context that I was looking for.
fields.summary: Workflow improvement after adding staged files - tab should go to commit message field

fields.description: It suddenly crashed, I honestly have no clue how it happened. I alt-tabbed back into sourcetree, but it crashed.
fields.summary: When alt-tabbed back to Sourcetree, it crashed

fields.description:
1. I'm in the 'Log / History' tab and i have uncommited changes
2. I press 'commit' button and i'm switched to 'File status' tab where i perform the commit and confirm by pressing the [commit] text button
3. the tab 'File status'  remains active, while i should be switched to the  'Log / History' tab where i was before i started commiting. 

Otherwise i have to chamge it manyally everytime i commit anything
fields.summary: After starting commiting, 'File status' tab is made active, but when I'm done commiting 'Log / History' is not re-set as active

fields.description:
I was prompted to update source tree, and after uninstalling the old version the updated started reinstalling with version 1.6.3, but the installer crashes with the following message (copied from the windows event viewer): I cannot use or install any version of Source tree on this machine now! 

The description for Event ID 10011 from source MsiInstaller cannot be found. Either the component that raises this event is not installed on your local computer or the installation is corrupted. You can install or repair the component on the local computer.

If the event originated on another computer, the display information had to be saved with the event.

The following information was included with the event: 

Product: SourceTree -- Key not valid for use in specified state.

(NULL)
(NULL)
(NULL)
(NULL)
(NULL)

the message resource is present but the message is not found in the string/message table

0020: 43 34 37 43 41 7D         C47CA}
fields.summary: After running 1.6.3 update, all Source tree installers fail with error: SourceTree -- Key not valid for use in specified state.

fields.description:
Some keyboard shortcuts would be great. Just about anything that I move my mouse to click should be accessible via Keyboard shortcuts. So If I want am on a rep tab, the following could all be done via keyboard shortcuts 

1. Pull
2. Stage all changed files (or focus on staging area and stage one at a time)
3. Activate Commit
4. Pull
5. Etc.

If there are keyboard shortcuts, then at the very least they should show up in a tooltip when I mouse over the button used to activate that function and should show up in the Windows FAQ.
fields.summary: Short shortcuts when hovering over buttons

fields.description:
After resolving a conflict, the "Unstaged files" section got correctly updated. As I had used WinMerge for this, a .orig file was created. So I right-clicked on the file intending to delete it, but then I got the crash instead of the context menu.

I am not sure about the version, I think it is the immediate previous to the latest, current one.
fields.summary: Crash with right click after solving a conflict

fields.description: After every update, the icon of SourceTree in my taskbar is broken. I need to unpin and repin it to fix it.
fields.summary: Pinned taskbar icon broken after every update

fields.description:
In the new UI, when I stage files and click on the Commit button, the commit message box shows up. 

Would be good if focus auto-switched to the message box, such so that I could just start typing in there, without having to manually move focus with my mouse.
fields.summary: Click on Commit - Focus on Commit Message
When committing, cursor should be placed in textbox ready to enter commit message
When committing to a Mercurial repo, all files should be selected for commit as default.

fields.description: In Options > General there is a checkbox called "After committing, stay in commit dialog if there are still pending changes". Now it does nothing but I would like to see SourceTree much more user friendly and after committing, I would like to go back to "Log / History" tab. Is there any way to fix that thing?
fields.summary: After committing, don't stay in commit dialog

fields.description:
Attached exception thrown and application shut down.

I double clicked on a file (to send to editor) when viewing a previous commit.  I then clicked in the differences panel somewhere, unfortunately, can't be sure where.  The exception dialog appeared and the application shut down.

Using the 1.6.3.0 patch downloaded and installed today - but this isn't selectable in the affected versions above :\
fields.summary: Fatal error:  System.InvalidOperationException: 'Sorting' is not allowed during an AddNew or EditItem transaction.

fields.description:
Add option to add custom dictionaries?
Open Office dictionaries are a good option.
fields.summary: Option to add dictionarys

fields.description:
It would be really great to see feature called: "edit theme".

According to [release notes|http://www.sourcetreeapp.com/update/WindowsReleaseNotes.html]
we obtained 'Cleaner user interface' from 'SourceTree 1.6 version'.

I really appreciate work which you put into SourceTree for windows but, for me version above 1.5.2 is totally non-friendly.
While I am working with it I cannot focus on changes which are shown in internal source tree diff tool.

Are you going to include in future feature to change theme or something like that?
For now I using *SourceTree 1.5.2* back again.
fields.summary: Possibility to change user interface.

fields.description:
Normally, I can drag&drop a file from bottom view to upper view.
But after selecting together multiple files and unselecting them, I can no longer drag&drop those files individually.
fields.summary: Drag/drop when hovering over text doesn't work

fields.description:
Nothing happens when selecting a group of staged or unstaged files and clicking the Commit button in the top menu or selecting Commit Selected from the top Repository menu.

When a single file is selected or no files selected at all, the Commit button works - i.e.  the bottom commit menu is toggled (but I haven't actually tried to commit a file).

Steps to reproduce:

1. Make some changes to more than file in the repo.
2. Mark at least two unstaged files and click the main Commit button.

1. Make some changes to more than one file in the repo.
2. Stage at least two unstaged files.
3. Mark at least two staged files and click the main Commit button or select Commit Selected from the top Repository menu.
fields.summary: 1.6.3 - Can't commit selected files neither through the main Commit button nor through the Commit Selected menu option

fields.description:
Whenever you take an action in SourceTree, a progress dialog is shown over the repository view. Usually, the progress indicator is blue.

When an error occurs during processing the current task (e.g. committing files, staging files, merging, etc.), the progress indicator turns brown and an error message is shown in the dialog. Additionally, a Close button is shown.

Since I upgraded to version 1.6.1 earlier this week, whenever an error occurs, the Close button, even though clicked, does nothing; the dialog cannot be dismissed. The only alternative is to close the tab containing the git repository in question and then re-open the repository tab.

PLEASE NOTE: I checked for updates before creating this issue. As of 23-08-2014, version 1.6.3 is available. I installed this update in hopes that a critical issue such as this had been resolved. Unfortunately, the same behavior still occurs.

Platform:
Windows 7 SP1 with latest updates
IE11
Chrome (latest)
Firefox (latest)
.NET 4.5.1
fields.summary: Can't click Close button if any errors occur

fields.description:
Listen, your latest release 1.6.3 just made me smile. Awesome additions to the blanks screen of a clone (open explorer). Beautiful UI. 
YOu should put a little Visual Studio feedback/send smilely face on the menu. Just so I can tell you how awesome this product is.
Thanks for all the great work. And for crying out loud, charge for it. Optional even. Free for open source peeps. And $25 for a personal license. I just want to show you support. Nice work.
fields.summary: Smiley face

fields.description:
Neither pressing the Hotkey for commiting (alt+shit+c) or using the context menu in the staging menu opens up the commit window.


Also, I'm using 1.6.3 not 1.6.2, but there's no possibility to enter that.
fields.summary: Commit selected / commit shortcuts not working as expected

fields.description:
Opening/browsing the list on online repositories consistently gives the attached error message.

I verified that the login is correct, and I can also see all my repositories, but the error persists and pops up 3 times on this screen.
fields.summary: Error message with gitHUB account

fields.description:
(Also affects 1.6.3)

I have the "Refresh automatically when files change" option unchecked. When I have the "Uncommitted changes" row selected, and a particular file selected under Unstaged files, and I save some changes to that file in another program and then in SourceTree manually refresh by pressing F5 or going to View -> Refresh, the changes shown for the selected file do not update to reflect the newly saved version of the file.
fields.summary: Refresh does not work if Uncommitted Changes row is selected

fields.description: In Working Copy, Flat List (single column), Split View Staging.  If you right-click on a certain file (not all files cause the crash) in the Unstaged Files pane, it causes a crash
fields.summary: Right clicking on an unstaged file causes SourceTree to crash
SourceTree Crashes on a right mouse click

fields.description: When writing a commit message that has a JIRA issue number in it, e.g. {{CAC-675}}, the {{CAC}} is highlighted as a spelling error even though I have it setup as a JIRA project prefix in the repository settings.
fields.summary: Issue numbers should not be highlighted as spelling errors in commit message editor

fields.description: When looking at a diff in the Commit panel, it's hard to tell at a glance whether the "Hunk N: Lines X-Y .... [Stage hunk] [Discard hunk]" line belongs to the diff above or below it. In fact, it looks like it belongs to the diff above it since it is so close to that diff's scrollbar and there is no dividing line.
fields.summary: Hard to tell which change hunk buttons belong to
Crash after right-clicking in Unstaged files panel

fields.description: crash on remove gcm.jar
fields.summary: crash on remove gcm.jar

fields.description:
The problem started when I installed the 1.6.3 version.
I am using Window high contrast theme. That is white over black.
The problem is related to the list of files in the stages/unstage/... panels/windows
In the new release I see one file name displayed in white over black and the next line white over white and so on.. As a result I can not see some of the files unless I select the white over white line

This problem exist only in the new SourceTree version The old one was OK

.
fields.summary: Window 8 high contrast  - Stage/Unstage/.. panel file list viewing problem

fields.description: With the update to 1.6.*, list items in the working copy files list and staged files list have a lot more whitespace around the entries, making the list a lot less compact and severely hampering overview of files changed/moved/untracked/etc in those lists. Previes versions had a clean, compact list.
fields.summary: Reduce whitespace in working copy/staged files list

fields.description:
It seems to me like every time SourceTree detects file system changes, the code diff view is cleared.

Very annoying :(
fields.summary: Diff view keeps disappearing

fields.description:
Had uncommitted changes I didn't want to commit.
I clicked on one of them in the Unstaged files window and did a Ctrl-A to select all of them.  Then I right clicked and got the 'SourceTree has crashed' message.
fields.summary: Could not determine repository from: 'Commit'

fields.description: The context menu for a hunk is always empty when looking at the diffs for a stash. See top right corner in the attachment. An easy solution would be to simply hide the "..." button.
fields.summary: Hunk context menu is empty in a stash

fields.description: I am in the Log/History view, I select multiple files by selecting the bottom file, holding shift, and then selecting the top item. I then right click so I can choose to stage those files. I then get a crash. Logs attached.
fields.summary: Attempting to select multiple items in "Log/History" view and then right clicking causes crash

fields.description: In the diff view, the two buttons in the top right of each hunk says "Stage lines" and "Discard lines" whenever one or more lines are selected. This should probably say "Stage line" and "Discard line" when only one line is selected.
fields.summary: "lines" should not be in plural if only one line is selected
Fix Drag/Drop Staging When Cursor Starts Click Over Text

fields.description: "File Status"->"Show only:All"->click to select one unstaged file->right click->crash
fields.summary: "File Status"->"Show only:All"->click to select one unstaged file->right click->crash

fields.description:
When selecting multiple files or rows in the pending files list it would be nice to stage all selected files at once when clicking the checkbox of any of the selected rows.

On the other hand it then should be possible to unstage several files at once too by unchecking one of the checkboxes. If the selection contains staged as well as unstaged files the single unchecking or checking action should determine if all selected files should be staged or unstaged as a whole.
fields.summary: Stage multiple files with one click

fields.description:
After cherry pick merge, conflicts were identified.
Right-clicking on a conflicting file (unstaged files group) causes SourceTree to crash.

Crash report file is attached.
fields.summary: Unable to right-click on file with conflicts in the new version 1.6.2.0 - SourceTree crashes

fields.description:
i think it be very helpfull, when scrolling log window. Also it be very helpfull, if line from selected branch or selected revision become bold
!https://api.monosnap.com/image/download?id=bUAZpD0Gp3NOi4XUkeHDUMIEYdIvsM!
fields.summary: Coloring branches in branch list
Right click on staged file crashes program

fields.description: Just installed latest SourceTree update this morning and now it is crashing like crazy just trying to add a file to the index
fields.summary: Can't add file to index

fields.description:
I had conflicts shown in the lower box and wanted to right-click on them to solve the conflicts.
However, the context menu did not show up, but SourceTree showed the message as in the attachment.

The screenshot does not show the conflict files, but it appears that the crash appears on right-mouseclick on every file in the lower box.
At that moment I wanted the context menu to discard those files.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes at once after right-mouseclick to a conflict file

fields.description:
2014-08-22T15:30:14: Fatal error: 
System.InvalidOperationException: 'System.Windows.Documents.Run' is not a Visual or Visual3D.

2014-08-22T15:30:14: Stack trace: 
   at MS.Internal.Media.VisualTreeUtils.AsVisual(DependencyObject element, Visual& visual, Visual3D& visual3D)
   at SourceTree.Utils.GeneralHelper.GetVisualParent[T](Object childObject)

fields.description:
Application crashes to desktop when right clicking a file.

Steps to reproduce the bug:
* Open a local git repository
** Must have some committed files, unstaged changes are not necessary
* Go to File Status -> Working Copy
* In the Search Field, enter some string that produces a list of files in the repo
** Search result opens, showing files
* Right click on any unchanged committed file in the _Unstaged Files_ area
*Crash*

fields.summary: Right click on file in the unstaged files area -> Boom

fields.description:
Just upgraded to 1.6.2.0. This new version crashes every minute.

A simple scenario how to reproduce:
1. In the main window select "Uncommitted changes"
2. select several files in the bottom window (all types - new, changed, deleted)
3. click the right mouse button
It crashes

Another scenario:
1. In the main window select "Uncommitted changes"
2. just click ellipsis on a file that is deleted locally but not in the stage.
It crashes

When no uncommitted changes (or may be all changes are staged - didn't try), this is not reproduced.

Please, help how to restore the previous version?
Thanks! 

P.S. SourceTree created a kind of log or dump file and opened an Explorer window, but I've closed it. I can attach this file if you explain where to find it :)
fields.summary: SourceTree 1.6.2.0 crashes when unstaged Uncommitted Changes present

fields.description:
Currently, the search box is located above the diff view. 

It should be placed on top of the stage panel.
fields.summary: The Search box should be placed on top of the stage panel

fields.description: SourceTree 1.6.1 has a lower contrast in the UI. Everything white and light grey doesn't make things easier
fields.summary: SourceTree should improve colour contrast

fields.description:
When the branching graph is set to Date Order, the graph for a trivial branch shows the first in the next line with a different color, but I think it's more logical that the subsequent commits on top of the same parent to be the one creating the branch.

As an example see the attached branching graph where the yellow commit was the first commit, but the blue commit afterwards was responsible for not rebasing or pulling and would in my view deserve to be put out of the main line ...

This would make it easier to show, why frequent pulling and rebasing works best for us.

I have asked the same as a question here,
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/328393/trivial-branch-graph
fields.summary: trivial branch graph

fields.description:
It would be nice to setup default operation for file double click in Log/History. I prefer "External Diff" to be a default operation. 

I never need to run python scripts from this file list, witch seems to be current default operation for *.py files ;)
fields.summary: Default operation for file double click

fields.description: Since the last update (1.6.1) changes in MS Word documents are not shown as diff anymore. If a changed Word document is selected in the Log / History view, only the "Open 'Before'" and "Open 'After'" Buttons are shown in the right pane.
fields.summary: diff of MS Word documents don't work anymore since update

fields.description: Crash
fields.summary: Crash

fields.description: When in fluid staging or split view staging mode the respective sections have a title row "Staged files" or "Unstaged files". A nice enhancement would be to append a file count to that label showing how many files are currently in the respective section, e.g. when you stage 4 files the label could be "Staged files (4 files)".
fields.summary: Show number of files

fields.description: Having the fluid stating view enabled the performance is extremly poor during staging files when there are many modified files in the repository (i.e. > 50 files).
fields.summary: Performance problems with fluid staging

fields.description:
I was prompted to install the upgrade and after I did SourceTree repeatedly crashed. Can't get into SourceTree at all now.

Log file attached
fields.summary: Source Crashed

fields.description:
Supposed I have a bunch of uncommitted changes showing in the unstaged part of a split-view ...

If I click the "Unstaged files" box, everything moves up to the staged area. I don't necessarily understand why, but ok. Meanwhile, the box I just clicked never goes from unchecked to checked. It just stays unchecked. 

Meanwhile, before I clicked anything, the "Staged files" box was checked. Why? I don't know. What could that be signaling? When I clicked the "Unstaged files" box and the uncommitted changes moved to the staged area, this "Staged files" box remained checked. If I click it after the move, all the uncommitted changes move back to the unstaged area, but this damned box stays checked. If I click it while the uncommitted changes are all sitting in the unstaged area, nothing happens. It just stays checked.

I don't know what I'd expect the state of these boxes to be in at any time during this interaction - I'm having a hard time fathoming what the intended functionality is - but at the least, I'd expect a checkbox to sometimes show as checked and sometimes not. It's hard to say whether this is a bug. If it's not, it ranks highly on the list of worst interaction designs I've seen in recent times.

Is the intended functionality documented or exhibited anywhere?
fields.summary: "Staged files" checkbox stays checked all the time; "Unstaged files" never shows as checked ... can't tell whether its working as intended.

fields.description:
I have a bunch of uncommitted changes. I click the Stash button. I get a dialogue box that tells me stash will return my working copy to a clean state. I name the stash "test" and click OK.

Uncommitted changes still shows all of the files I supposedly just stashed as changed. The same changes also appear in the stash.

This all worked prior to upgrading to 1.6.*.
fields.summary: I stash changes, but they continue to appear as uncommitted changes.
